result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darnell Lamont Lindsay

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darnell Lamont Lindsay appeared by video.  Attorney Corey Flynn for Haley E Wentz in court for Darnell Lamont Lindsay.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference.  
Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. 
Case adjourned to Branch 15. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Darnell Lamont Lindsay in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Darnell Lamont Lindsay.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a calendar call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court vacates stayed warrant. Defense requests an adjourned status conference to allow time to discuss case with client. Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Darnell Lamont Lindsay not in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Darnell Lamont Lindsay.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case calendared for a status. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense has no explanation for defendants non appearance and request a calendar call date.  

Court ordered bench warrant issued, Remand to the Judge and STAYED issuance until the next court date. No action on bond. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 15.
Calendar call scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darnell Lamont Lindsay in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Calendar Call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court Canceled stayed bench warrant. 
Defense counsel in receipt of discovery and offer and  request additional status date.  Court ordered case adjourned. 
 Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant appeared at 10:00am by zoom and provided the next court date of 7-25-2022 at 8:30am.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Pretrial Conference. 
DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense has no explanation for defendants non appearance and  request a calendar call date.  
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to the Commissioner and no action on bail and STAYED issuance until the next court date.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be in person.  Calendar call scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Court ordered no contact with T. Foster
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Darnell Lamont Lindsay in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Darnell Lamont Lindsay in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darnell Lamont Lindsay appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  
This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion:   https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
